results.title: The Migrant experience. Parts 1-3
results.creator_credit: Ben Lewin, Karl McPhee, Malcolm Smith and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A series, made up of six episodes, that presents a comprehensive history of the role of migration in the development of Australia’s nationhood. Part One: Setting out - looks at the general history of migration to Australia over 200 years. Part Two: Of dreams and reasons - looks at the reasons why people left their homelands and came to Australia. Part Three: First encounters - looks at how they were received.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ben Lewin, Karl McPhee, Malcolm Smith and Film Australia

results.title: The Mighty Volga (D)
results.brief_description: A cruise down the Volga River reveals some of Russia’s interesting sites. Includes newsreel clips of the battle of Stalingrad. WARNING: Contains disturbing footage of fish being “clubbed” in order to keep blood in the abdominal cavity so as to keep the fish alive when it is sliced open to remove the fish eggs for caviar.

results.title: The Mighty steam calliope
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: One of the most unusual musical instruments around, ‘the mighty steam calliope’ runs on steam produced by a ton of ‘gofer’ wood and needs a team of eight horses to pull it. Owned by the Minnie Thomson Memorial Museum of Stratford, Ontario, and fired by Duncan MacDermid, this calliope is one of the last of its kind. Taking in its energetic performance is a great way to spend a summer afternoon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ianzelo, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Mighty Boosh
results.brief_description: The Mighty Boosh is a British comedy television show created by Julian Barratt, Noel Fielding and others, that is best defined as a comic fantasy containing humour and pop-culture references.

constellations_other.name: Sci-fi, surrealism and strangeness
constellations_other.description: Step through Portal 2 to explore the links between its sci-fi comedy and the world of film and TV.

results.description:
The Mighty Boosh is a British comedy television show created by Julian Barratt, Noel Fielding and others. The Mighty Boosh is a comic fantasy containing humour and pop-culture references. Episodes often featured elaborate musical numbers in different genres, such as electro, heavy metal, funk, and rap. The show has been known for popularising a style called “crimping”; short a cappella songs which are present throughout all three series. Julian Barratt wrote the music within the show, and performs it with Noel Fielding. Fielding also designed many of the show’s graphics and artwork.

The TV series has many animated sequences, puppets and special effects. Barratt has said that he approached Fielding with the idea of doing a show like The Goodies, as if it were a complete “world” rather than simply a sketch show. Barratt and Fielding play many of the recurring and one-off characters themselves, with other characters being played by other Boosh members Rich Fulcher, Dave Brown, and Michael Fielding.
description_for_label:
The Mighty Boosh is a British comedy television show created by Julian Barratt, Noel Fielding and others. The Mighty Boosh is a comic fantasy containing humour and pop-culture references. Episodes often featured elaborate musical numbers in different genres, such as electro, heavy metal, funk, and rap. The show has been known for popularising a style called “crimping”; short a cappella songs which are present throughout all three series. Julian Barratt wrote the music within the show, and performs it with Noel Fielding. Fielding also designed many of the show’s graphics and artwork.

The TV series has many animated sequences, puppets and special effects. Barratt has said that he approached Fielding with the idea of doing a show like The Goodies, as if it were a complete “world” rather than simply a sketch show. Barratt and Fielding play many of the recurring and one-off characters themselves, with other characters being played by other Boosh members Rich Fulcher, Dave Brown, and Michael Fielding.

results.title: The Midfield player with Trevor Brooking
results.creator_credit: Terry Ryan, Ray Marshall and Opix Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus on Soccer”.
England midfield man, Trevor Brooking, one of the Football League’s most stylish players describes the importance of the midfield role. He stresses that midfield players must possess all-round ability.

results.title: The Middle path
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Barnes, Alan Bateman and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Journey into Thailand”.
Keith Adam presents this program which offers a visit to the small market town of Chom Thong which provides a glimpse of life in a Buddhist monastery. It shows how the monastery and the monks play a vital part in the day-to-day life of the town.

results.title: The Middle East: crossroads of three continents
results.brief_description: The scarcity of rainfall and water supply, the significance of being an international crossroad and the importance of rich oil deposits are three key ideas developed in relation to the countries of the Middle East. Their need for water and its effect on their economy is illustrated. The region is considered as a crossroads of peoples, historic cultures and trade. Three-quarters of the world’s reserves of oil are found here; this valuable product has had an important effect on relations of the Middle East with the rest of the world.

results.title: The Middle East
results.creator_credit: William L. Claiborne, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Presents the Middle East during the late 1950”s and the various problems it was facing at that time: Christianity and Mohammedans, the nomadic Bedouin and the effect of changes; water, locust plagues and primitive farming methods; peasants and absentee landlords; disease, malnutrition and illiteracy. In contrast there was also a growing modern metropolis, and an emerging middle class education, the oil industry and the Aswan Dam. All this resulting in internal tensions and an intense growing nationalism.

results.title: The Middle East
results.brief_description: Discusses the religious and historical background of the lands of the Middle East. Describes the way of life of a peasant. Surveys the agricultural resources and rich oil deposits of the Middle East.
